course.subject: ECON
course.name: Introductory Environmental and Health Economics
course.description: This course introduces students to basic theories and findings in environmental and health economics. The emphasis is on how the economic models and concepts can be used to analyze environmental and health issues. The course begins with an introduction of theoretical economic concepts and models; then it moves on to several policy-relevant environmental and health topics. Particular issues include externality, common goods and public goods, valuation of environmental goods and health, market failure and health, environmental regulations, pollution and health, and the economics of climate change.
course.exclusions: ENVR 2310, SOSC 2310

reviews.author: Jiho
reviews.comment_content:
The content is very interesting.
Learning Objectives:
 Understand basic economic models (1.1)
 Use economic models to analyze environmental issues (1.3)
 Foster economic intuition to understand social problems (1.2)
 Understand the methods to value non-market goods (such as life and nature) and the
controversies (8.3)
 Evaluate environmental and health policies (4.2)
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor HE teaches really well and has interactions with students even it was held online.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is very lenient. Got an A range even my final was not satisfactory.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is bit heavy (as there are assignments and final reports), but the questions are not that hard to get a full mark.

reviews.author: ccheryl
reviews.title: nice prof, but heavy workload
reviews.comment_content: the first half of the course is mostly the dse econ syllabus, like demand and supply, externality, trade barriers, international trading) so if you didnt study econ before, you better not reg it, otherwise you may suffer) the second half, after the midterm, is more related to the environmental side, beyond the scope of dse econ syllabus

but sometimes he may be a little bit rush for some content in the last few topics which are more difficult in general cuz he accidentally spent more time on teaching the easier ones.

reviews.author: Trafalgar Law
reviews.title: Good for those with ECON background
reviews.comment_content:
I may divide the course content into two parts: first part is the content that overlap with many ECON DSE contents, and this part is basically the mid-term syllabus. (e.g. externality, tax, subsidy, trade barriers, etc)
The second part is not related to the Econ that we usually talk about. It is more about the method we use to conduct research on some pollution or social issues, such as BCA (benefit-cost analysis) But basically the content is very very easy, and all the things you have to do is to remember the name of different research method LOL.
reviews.comment_teaching: I don't know why but the last few lessons are extremely boring for me. I can't stop looking at my phone. But overall he has a clear speech and has a normal teaching skills, at least not a trap LOL. He is kind to accept any comments and answer any enquiries, a good guy haha.
